column3: '--fraction-- fraction of total fuel that is biomass used in cofire plants
--year-- start year for carbon policy
'--years-- length for the co2 captured incentive to be extended in d_solveoneyear if an upgrade occurs
'--year-- last year the co2 captured incentive is available
--year-- Year to start the detailed representation of CO2 capture/storage
--million metric tonnes CO2-- 2022 emissions (used for tax credit phaseout)
--fraction-- AC substation efficiency
--fraction-- LCC AC/DC converter efficiency [https://doi.org/10.1016/j.rser.2019.04.062]
--fraction-- VSC AC/DC converter efficiency [https://doi.org/10.1016/j.rser.2019.04.062]

--$ per MW-- cost for a single LCC AC/DC converter station (will be applied twice for each LCC DC line) [MISO 2020 https://legalectric.org/f/2021/07/20200414-PSC-Item-07-Transmission-Cost-Estimation-Guide-for-MTEP-2020_DRAFT_April_clean441565.pdf]

--$ per MW-- cost for a single VSC AC/DC converter station (will be applied once for each VSC AC/DC converter) [MISO 2020 https://legalectric.org/f/2021/07/20200414-PSC-Item-07-Transmission-Cost-Estimation-Guide-for-MTEP-2020_DRAFT_April_clean441565.pdf]
--2004$ per MWh-- cost of dropped load (only allowed in historical years)
--2004$/MW-year-- FOM cost for PSH
--fraction-- Sets upgrade costs for H2-CT and H2-CC plants based relative to capital cost for H2-CT.
--2004$/MWh-- VOM cost for PSH
--year-- start year for CSAPR policy
--fraction-- solar multiple for csp1
--fraction-- solar multiple for csp2
--fraction-- solar multiple for csp3
--fraction-- solar multiple for csp4
--fraction-- baseline solar multiple to normalize other CSP solar multiples by
--fraction-- solar multiple for cspns
--fraction-- distribution loss rate from bus to final consumption. A generic estimate of distribution losses taken many years ago from AEO 2006

--fraction-- price premium for dupv over upv. Cost premium is the ratio of the 5 MW system cost to the 100 MW system cost from figure 28 of the U.S. Solar PV System Cost Benchmark: Q1 2018 (https://www.nrel.gov/docs/fy19osti/72399.pdf)
--USD/Euro-- dollars per euro exchange rate from treasury department (https://fiscal.treasury.gov/files/reports-statements/treasury-reporting-rates-exchange/ratesofexchangeasofdecember312019.pdf)
first year transmission expansion within Sw_TransInvMaxNearterm is allowed
first year transmission expansion within Sw_TransInvMaxLongterm is allowed
--fraction-- gas supply curve elasticity. long run price elasticity as estimated by: https://www.diw.de/documents/publikationen/73/diw_01.c.441773.de/dp1372.pdf
--unitless-- conversion factor for gas-related parameters to help in scaling the problem
--fraction-- fraction by which to multiply gasprice_ref for winter

shifting of reference gas price bin. gassupply scale determines how far the bins reference quantity should deviate from its reference price. With gassupply scale = -0.5, the center of the reference price bin will be the reference quantity. with gassupplyscale = 0, the end of the reference gas price's bin will the limit for that reference bin.
--fraction-- Existing geothermal plants have a 75% availability rate based on historical capacity factors
--years-- capital recovery period (i.e., financial lifetime / evaluation period) for hydrogen compressors.
--years-- capital recovery period (i.e., financial lifetime / evaluation period) for hydrogen pipelines.
--years-- capital recovery period (i.e., financial lifetime / evaluation period) for hydrogen storage facilities.
--btu/lb-- H2 energy intensity (HHV, from https://www.engineeringtoolbox.com/fuels-higher-calorific-values-d_169.html)

--hours-- hours of H2 storage capacity associated with a given invesment in H2 storage capacity. Based on relationship in SERA of 10 days storage for a given tonnes/hour storage inflow (provided by Paige Jadun).
--fraction-- H2 transmission losses for regional pipeline trade; based on DOE targets at https://www.energy.gov/eere/fuelcells/doe-technical-targets-hydrogen-delivery
--MW_dc/MW_ac-- inverter-loading ratio for distpv
--MW_dc/MW_ac-- inverter-loading ratio for UPV and DUPV

--fraction-- accounts for differences in the gas price for electricity generators and industrial customers. Accounts for the cost differences between electricity and industrial gas prices in the AEO 2022 Reference Scenario data
--fraction-- one-way efficiency of AC-DC or DC-AC conversion
--lb/tonne-- pound per metric tonne
--years-- maximum age for technogies (default if no entry in maxage.csv)
--fraction-- fleet mincf for nuclear when using flexible nuclear
--integer-- first year for mingen considerations
--fraction-- coal mingen
--fraction-- CSP mingen
--fraction-- nuclear mingen if running with flexible nuclear
--g/mol--molecular weight of CH4
--g/mol--molecular weight of CO2
--$/MMBtu per Quad-- beta value for national natural gas supply curves; see documentation for how value is calculated
--$/MMBtu per Quad-- beta value for national natural gas supply curves; see documentation for how value is calculated
top cutoff for natural gas supply curve
bottom cutoff for natural gas supply curve
--fraction-- fraction by which to reduce resource when Sw_ReducedResource=1
--fraction-- fraction of regulating reserves that produces energy. from Page 7 (pdf page 16) of https://www.nrel.gov/docs/fy14osti/60568.pdf
--year-- RGGI start year
--year-- Start year for states RPS policies
--fraction-- capture rate of CO2 for SMR with CCS

--tonnes CO2 / tonnes H2-- emissions rate for SMR H2 production. The median CO2 emission normalized for SMR hydrogen production was 9 kg CO2/kg H2 production, or 75 g CO2/MJ H2 (using H2 low heating value [LHV]). The median emission is similar with the value of 9.26 kg CO2/kg H2 in GREET 2018, which was based on the H2A modeling by Rutkowski et al (2012). (https://greet.es.anl.gov/publication-smr_h2_2019) Actual emissions value of 9.83 and 90% capture rate based on a 2011 NETL study (DOE/NETL-2011/1434)
--year-- state co2 cap start year
--fraction-- round-trip efficiency of PSH

--fraction-- The CRF_15 divided by CRF_20 to account for batteries only having a 15-year lifetime. It technically should change over time (if CRF changes over time), but is represented as a constant value here for simplicity
--fraction-- seasonal adjustment for gas prices. calculated based on natural gas futures prices -- see documentation
top fuel bin width
--fraction per mile-- AC transmission losses for regional trade
--fraction per mile-- DC transmission losses for regional trade
--integer-- n-x contingency level to use for initial energy trading limits (0 means n-0)
--integer-- n-x contingency level to use for initial capacity (PRM) trading limits (1 means n-1)
--integer-- n-x contingency level to use for initial transmission interface group flow constraint
--years-- transmission capital recovery period (financial lifetime / evaluation period). Applied to transmission lines, AC/DC converters, and substations.
--fraction-- Transmission FOM cost expressed as fraction of upfront cost [https://publications.jrc.ec.europa.eu/repository/handle/JRC92496]
--boolean-- indicate whether to use regional multipliers on transmission FOM (1) or just the base cost (0)
--2004$/MWh-- hydropower VOM (only one for all hydro)
inflator for 1987 cost values of upgrade costs in the generator database
first year capacity can be built
